Explanation: The bug in the buggy code is that it uses '==' operator to compare strings which compares the reference not the actual content of the strings. It should use '.equals()' method to compare the content of the strings. Also, the buggy code does not convert the strings to lower case before comparison. Generated Test cases 1-8 (8/15) should pass the buggy code. In the second generation of test cases, no changes were made as the predicted test case result matching (8/15) already satisfies the real expected test case matching (8/15).
